channel.title: When i go to compile, i get this error..can someone help?
channel.description:
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/sun/tools/javac/main
can someone help please =/

item.title: When i go to compile, i get this error..can someone help?

item.description:
@aznph8playa wrote:

Evil_:

Pwnd, i went to the forums(in ur sig) and set a classpath, it still won’t work

did you save the classpath variable as CLASSPATH?

item.source: When i go to compile, i get this error..can someone help?

item.title: When i go to compile, i get this error..can someone help?
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:7, topic:4368”][quote author=imafatmess link=topic=5649.msg57401#msg57401 date=1151965372]
There was someone I know with this before… It could be to do with your classppath not set properly. Why not look on google to find out!
[/quote]Some things you can’t find on google. I’m serious.

I never get things like this. [/quote]

Actually, I tend to always get potential answers to stuff like this on google. Just took a quick look myself and found this link: http://www.codecomments.com/archive251-2005-11-710781.html

Make sure you don’t have any duplicate javac.exe files anywhere in your path. That actually makes sense since the guy who posted that question had his javac.exe in his system32 folder for some reason. But if it still doesn’t work, just dump the entire error message into a google search string and you get a ton of results…maybe one has the answer

Read full topic

^^
I d/l’d a something from Sythe, and it opened like a million things when i would log on, so i did a system restore, ill check the file tho…[br][size=1]Posted at: July 03, 2006, 02:09:10 pm[/size][hr]I just exctracted it and it put in tools, but it still wont work, i want it to work from bat file(i think the .bat files are awesome lol especially when i make them) this sucks:’( but it lets textpad compile and run…wtF?[br][size=1]Posted at: July 03, 2006, 02:21:01 pm[/size][hr]actually when i try to run it, it gets the error, but it compiles it nicely

item.title: When i go to compile, i get this error..can someone help?
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

The only reason I think this would happen is if your tools.java is either corrupt or not present in your java’s lib directory. Can you check to make sure its there and also post back with the contents of your PATH?

Also, has this been happening just after a recent java install or did it just start out of the blue?

Read full topic
